name: Diary of Deliverance Hobbs
physical_description: A small, leather-bound diary from the late 17th century. The ink is faded, and the pages smell of woodsmoke and fear.
history: The personal account of a woman accused during the Salem witch trials. It was passed down through her family and eventually sold at an estate auction in Arkham.
content_summary: Describes folk magic rituals meant to ward off 'The Black Man of the Forest'. The descriptions of this entity bear a disturbing resemblance to modern accounts of Nyarlathotep.
